Phase One

September, 2018 - March, 2019

Continued Pilot

We are happy to announce that our pilot has been extended due to new development resources (see "About Andela" section below). We will be continuing to work with our existing partners, offering Roo to new clients of financial coaching. You can see the latest data summary by visiting our (quick and dirty) dashboard (best viewed on desktop).

IDEO.org's funding to work on Roo officially ends October 1, 2018. We have reserved a couple hours a week and enough funds to cover the continued pilot, but no further design or research will take place after October 1st.

We will be seeking further funding to continue working on Roo. See sections below for more on our plans and dreams for what Roo could become.

Development

All development will be tracked on our Trello board. Follow along!

Although IDEO.org's day-to-day work will cease on October 1, 2018, we have partnered with a development company (Andela - see below for more) who has agreed to work on Roo free of charge. A member of IDEO.org will help manage the continued development of Roo with the partner to ensure continuity and quality.

In this phase, we hope to develop the following features (in no particular order):

  • Task Search
  • Coach can create and save a copy of a template task
  • Coach can add filter tags to custom tasks
  • Custom tasks can be saved and reusable
  • Note when a client has come back for a new session
  • Mark favorite tasks for quick reference
  • Delete a client
  • Delete a goal
  • Share a custom task with other coaches
  • Printer-friendly workplan
  • Archive/Unarchive a task
  • User friendly error messages
  • New branding/styling
  • Ability to re-order steps in edit mode for a task
  • Add to template tasks
  • Improved client sign-in for viewing their workplan
  • Data Export (CSV)
  • Coach Profile
  • Admin Profile
  • Admin can add/delete and manage coaches
  • Images in chatlog
  • Org and coach dashboards
  • An adminstrator can create an account for their organization at a public URL and launch Roo without IDEO.org

About Andela

Andela is African software development company with offices in Lagos, Nairobi and Kampala. Their model includes an apprenticeship period for every new developer they hire. During this time, apprentices work on real-life projects alongside senior developers, of which Roo is one. Andela believes in the power of open-source software and is supportive of Roo for its social benefits. For these reasons and because of the experience it provides its new developers, Andela has generously offered to work on our feature list for no charge.

Qualitative and Quantitative Impact Analysis

We will be conducting qualitative interviews with coaches and clients to gain insights on the user experience for both user types. For quantitative analysis, we have hired a data science team (BCT Partners) to cross-referencing the user data from Roo with client financial data from our partners.

At the center of all our work on Roo are the following questions, which are part of our theory of change.

Clients - product interaction

  • How frequently / consistently are clients responding?
  • Whatâ€™s the level of click-through to content?
  • Are any prompts/activities drive more/less interaction?
  • Are they marking tasks complete within the bot?

Clients - influence on financial coaching engagement

  • Are clients completing their action plan tasks?
  • Is the return rate to follow-up appointments improving?
  • Do clients feel empowered and supported in their coaching journey?

Coaches - product interaction

  • Are coaches using the chatbot consistently with clients to set and review action plans?
  • Do coaches find the Template Tasks useful?
  • What challenges are they facing in effectively or consistently using the chatbot?
  • Are they using the chatbot in any unintended or unexpected ways?

Coaches - coach experience

  • Does the chatbot make workplan creation easier?
  • Do they feel their clients have more clarity / better eqipped to tackle issues?
  • Does it make their job easier?
  • Is there a demand from coaches for this product?
  • Does this increase client confidence and connection on subsequent visits?

Support

We will continue to provide technical support (via the chat widget or email) for coaches and administrators.

If you are interested in implementing our code base for your own organization and have questions about how to do this, we suggest you read through this site throroughly and then contact us if you have futher questions: info@helloroo.org.
